title: 3rd Asia Pacific Pharmacovigilance Training Course
address: JSS University College of Pharmacy, Mysore
details: <p><font size="2" color="#000000" face="trebuchet ms">Adverse drug reactions (ADRs) are a major public health problem, and drug safety monitoring is of paramount importance to public health. An understanding of the clinical aspects of ADRs and the principles of drug safety are fundamental requirements for any professional working in the fields of pharmacovigilance or patient care.</font></p><p><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: &quot;trebuchet ms&quot;; font-size: small;">This two week course, organised by JSS University and Uppsala Monitoring Centre (UMC), provides a solid practical foundation for those working in drug safety and aims to develop pharmacovigilance knowledge and skills in the Asia Pacific region. The course draws on the 18 years of experience UMC has in providing education and training to a global network of pharmacovigilance experts and healthcare professionals. The Asia Pacific course is tailored to regional needs and addresses challenges unique to this area.</span></p>

details: An 8-week Yoga Therapist training program<div><br></div><div>Entry is FREE</div>

title: Traditional Hatha Yoga Teacher Training in India
details: <p><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">30 Day Spiritual Adventure with traditional teachers at AyurYoga Eco-Ashram, between Mysore and Kerala, South India. From 17 November - 15 December, 2016</font></p><p><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">One month yoga teacher training retreat to experience the intensive and spiritual teachings and practices of traditional Hatha yoga - with more emphasis on breathing, awareness, meditation and practical philosophy to live an enlightened life in society. Also, you will be presented with a professional yoga teacher certification diploma, recognized by Yoga Alliance, with which you can start teaching yoga professionally around the world.</font></p><p><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">This 200 hours Yoga Teacher Training covers all the basic techniques and skills to get started on the noble path of sharing your practical knowledge of yoga - both practical &amp; intellectual - in a professional way. Even if you are not interested in teaching yoga, the practices and philosophy classes have detoxifying effect that will enrich your body, mind and intellect and helps you to understand the purpose of life and know-how to live a sane and peaceful life.</font></p><p><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">AyurYoga Eco-Ashram in India is a very unique place set in 20 acres of Organic Farm under development. We are located in the quiet countryside, one hour from Mysore, south India, on the banks of Kabini River.</font></p>

title: Ayurvedic Yoga Massage Training
details: <font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">A 3 to 12-day training course open to everyone and all levels, beginners and professionals to discover, learn or deepen the method of Ayurvedic Yoga Massage.</font><div><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">Participants can register for 3, 6, 9 or the entire 12-day course.<br><br>12-DAY LEVELS 1-4 CERTIFIED THERAPIST COURSE: Nov. 16-29<br>Level 1 Introductory and Fundamentals part 1: Nov. 16-18<br>Level 2 Fundamentals part 2: Nov. 19-22 (20 is off)<br>Level 3 Advanced: Nov. 23-25<br>Level 4 Certified Therapist: Nov. 26-29 (27 is off)<br>12:30pm-4:30pm<br><br>12-DAY LEVEL 5 THERAPIST DIPLOMA COURSE: Nov. 16-29<br>Level 5 is accessible only to students who have previously completed Levels 1-4<br>12:30pm-4:30pm (Class timing will fit, as much as possible, the KPJAYI chanting or other shalas' afternoon classes)<br>Day off on Sunday 20 and 27<br><br>You can also register to the masterclass on morning time:<br><br>4-DAY MASTERCLASS SERIES: NOV.22-25<br>Phase 1 (part 1 of 3) – The Lumbar Spine: Nov.22-23<br>Phase 2 – The Scapulae Belt: Nov.24-25<br>9:15am-11:30am (TBC)<br><br>FEES<br>-&gt; L.1-4 Certified Therapist: €580 EUR<br>-&gt; L.5 Therapist Diploma: €580 EUR<br>-&gt; L.1 Introduction and Fundamentals part 1: €180 EUR<br>-&gt; MasterClass : €70 EUR per Phase on 2-day<br>-&gt; Massage during on Clinic Day: INR1000 Minimum donation given to charitable organizations in Mysore<br><br>ONLINE REGISTRATION FORM<br><a href="http://www.anantamassage.com/courses/registration.html?country=India&amp;city=Mysore#gf_5" target="_blank" style="background: rgb(255, 255, 255);">http://www.anantamassage.com/courses/registration.html?country=India&amp;city=Mysore#gf_5</a><br><br>REGISTRATION:<br>+91-7507018875 (WhatsApp)<br><a href="http://allevents.in/mysore/ayurvedic-yoga-massage-training-in-mysore/1705112959728061#" style="background: rgb(255, 255, 255);">contact@arym.org</a><br>NB. Priority given to L.1-4 and L.1-5 Registration<br><br>VENUE<br>ARYM Institute, 10th A main Road, near Doctors Corner, Gokulam 3rd stage, Mysore, India<br><br>FURTHERMORE<br><a href="http://www.anantamassage.com/courses/as/india/india_en.html#NOV_2016_MYSORE" target="_blank" style="background: rgb(255, 255, 255); outline: 0px;">www.anantamassage.com/courses/as/india/india_en.html#NOV_2016_MYSORE</a></font><br></div>

title: Mahapeede Mahablu - a Kannada play

title: 2nd Annual Conference on Emerging Trends in Marketing
tag_words: Marketing Seminar, Emerging Trends in Marketing
address: SDMIND, #1, Siddharthanagar Post, Chamundi Hill Road, Mysore
details: <p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);"><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2">Marketing has undergone a tectonic shift in the past decade. The exponential growth and diffusion of technology and increasing demands by customers have put the marketers in an unenviable spot. The conventional marketing concepts of 4 Ps, PLC and STP is undergoing a refresh and reboot.</font></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);"><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2">New paradigms, innovation and advanced practices in marketing are emerging by the day – be it usage of big data in customer relationship, data analytics in media planning and promotion, intensive and targeted use of social media in marketing communication, apps and videos as a tool for customer engagement, Omni-channel in retailing, servitization in services marketing, growing importance of ethics, sustainability and social responsibility in marketing, flipping of B2B marketing from being sales driven to customer experience driven…. the list is endless.</font></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);"><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2">The marketers are challenged at every stage. While the management and CFOs demand maximum ROI on marketing investment, the customers on the other hand demand maximum worth for their dosh. The marketer is caught between sea and devil.</font></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">Registration is Free.</p>

title: Mega Matrimony Meet - Brahmin Community
details: <p><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">Sri Sankara Matrimony is organizing a 'Mega Matrimony Meet' for Brahmin community on October 23rd, 2016 in the<br>Shi Sharada Peetham, Mysuru, Karnataka 570004</font></p><p><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">How to participate:</font></p><p><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">Call 080-4300 0999 to participate in the meet.</font></p><p><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">Prospective brides and grooms from Brahmin community residing in Udupi and other nearby places [Mysuru] can register. For queries, you can call us on 080-43000099 or 90 19 300 600. You can also get more detail on&nbsp;</font><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: &quot;trebuchet ms&quot;; font-size: small;">www.srisankaramatrimony.com and write back to us.</span></p>

title: Mysore Dasara Bicycle Race - 2016
address: Chamundi Vihar Stadium, Hyder Ali Road, Nazarbad, Mysore
details: <p><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">Mysore Dasara is the Nadahabba (state-festival) of the state of Karnataka and as always professional bike race season is back. The action kicks off in earnest at the Mysuru District and People’s Choice Classic on October 9th 2016, with races then taking place around the state.<br><br><strong>Race Details</strong></font></p><ul style="padding: 0px 0px 0px 20px;"><li><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">For Men, the race is for a distance of 100&nbsp;kilometers:&nbsp;2 laps of the ring road and the finishing line on Chamundi Betta.</font></li><li><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">For Women, the race is for a distance of 54&nbsp;kilometers: 1 lap of the ring road and the finishing line is on Chamundi Betta.</font></li><li><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">The races will be flagged off from Chamundi Vihar Stadium at 6 am on October 9, 2016.</font></li><li><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">The prize money for top 6 places is 1,55,000/- for each category.</font></li></ul><p><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000"><br><strong>Registrations:</strong>&nbsp;At Cyclopedia Interested may register before October 8 by 4 pm at Cyclopedia. [0821-4252299]</font></p><p><font face="trebuchet ms" size="2" color="#000000">Note: No Spot Registrations</font></p>

title: Mysore Dasara Event - Day 10
details: <font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">Mysore Dasara procession - Jamboo Savari:</font><div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">A traditional Dasara procession, the main attraction of this procession is the idol of the Goddess Chamundeshwari which is placed in a Golden Howdah on the top of a decorated elephant.<br></font></div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">The original name to this procession is 'Jumbi Savari' (going to the Shami tree).</font></div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">After the Jamboo Savari, a torchlight parade takes place in the evening at the Bannimantap Parade Grounds.</font></div></div><div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">Various cultural music and dance concerts are held in auditoriums&nbsp;</font></div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">around Mysore city.</font></div></div>

title: Mysore Dasara Event - Day 9
details: <div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">Mahanavami / Ayudha Pooja:</font></div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">The ninth day is called "Mahanavami".</font></div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">The royal family performs the Ayudha Pooja as a part of Dasara, inside the palace grounds. A&nbsp;series of rituals are observed, the first being worship of the weapons on the Mahanavami Day&nbsp;(9th day), followed by 'Kusumananda' - the tradition of breaking a pumpkin in the palace&nbsp;grounds. After this, the weapons are carried in a golden palanquin to the Bhuvaneshwari temple&nbsp;for worship. The royal sword is worshipped and is taken on a procession involving elephants,&nbsp;camels and horses.</font></div><div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">Various cultural music and dance concerts are held in auditoriums&nbsp;</font></div><div><font size="2" face="trebuchet ms" color="#000000">around Mysore city.</font></div></div>

title: Mysore Dasara Event - Day 8
address: Mysore Palace,  Jagan Mohan Palace, Kala Mandir
details: <div><font color="#000000" size="2" face="trebuchet ms">Durgashtami:</font></div><div><font color="#000000" size="2" face="trebuchet ms">The 8th day is ‘Durgashtami’. This day is devoted to Durga worship.</font></div><div><font color="#000000" size="2" face="trebuchet ms">On this day, a deep fried crispy lentil-based fritters is offered to the goddess and special prayers are offered to her.</font></div><div><div><font color="#000000" size="2" face="trebuchet ms">Various cultural music and dance concerts are held in auditoriums&nbsp;</font></div><div><font color="#000000" size="2" face="trebuchet ms">around Mysore city.</font><br></div></div>

title: Mysore Dasara Event - Day 7
address: Mysore Palace, Jagan Mohan Palace, Kala Mandir
details: <div><font color="#000000" face="trebuchet ms" size="2">Sapthami:</font></div><div><font color="#000000" face="trebuchet ms" size="2">The seventh day is called "Sapthami".</font></div><div><font color="#000000" face="trebuchet ms" size="2">On this day, Saraswathi - the goddess of learning, is worshipped, with special offerings like&nbsp;Usli / Gugri (a dish prepared using black gram) and Yeriappa (a sweet dish). Books, palm leaf manuscripts, and writing materials are worshiped on that day.</font></div><div><div><font color="#000000" face="trebuchet ms" size="2">Various cultural music and dance concerts are held in auditoriums&nbsp;</font></div><div><font color="#000000" face="trebuchet ms" size="2">around Mysore city.</font></div></div>

title: Mysore Dusshera
details: Mysore Dasara is the Nadahabba or the State-Festival of the State of Karnataka, called as Navaratri meaning Nine-Nights, a 10-day festival, celebrated with utmost spectacle and joy in the city of Mysore. The Dasara festivities have arich history of more than 400 years<br>
